TopicTitle: How To Speak Kerbal! With Translator!

Articles.Content:
Here are my translations of the Kerbal language, as we know kerbals speak Spanish, that is reversed.

HELP WANTED!

please pm if interested in helping out with the language, i didnt expect so many people viewing this and interested so this is starting to be too much for one guy, mainly it involves finding suitable phonetic alphabet words and just updating the language and maybe adding some language rules, also needed is someone who is Mexican or of Spanish decent who is fluent in Spanish to help check the translations as i'm just a american whos better at German and has been using Google translate, and someone who knows html or batch to help with the offline version, if you know java thats better, my java coding is rusty at best, Cheers!

Also its best to pronounce these words with a German or Russian accent

Thanks to astropapi1 for more words

Only 1 planet so far is know to have multiple names, Eve which some kerbals call "VÃƒÂ­areps" or "Ave"

depending on the dialect, Eve is a central/equatorial name while northern regions have been known to call it "Ave" then the southern kerbals call eve "Viareps", most likely because the southern regions representatives got lost and ended up in the bar drink naming section.

I am working on a offline version, it will take awhile but it will also include the different dialects of kerban, like a english german and hardest one, russian equivalents, if you wish to help please PM me, THANKS!

This has potential. I'm going to start typing my rocket names in kerbish using this format.
Pronouncing a word spelled backwards is not the same as reversing audio of the word pronounced normally.

Wtf...

Kerbals speak a form of spanish?

Assuming kerbals aren't humans and kerbin isn't Earth, they should speak a completely diff lang IMO.

-snip-

You forgot the most important word - failure!

You forgot the most important word - failure!

Fixed it!
Failure? I do believe you mean "When the walls fell."

Wtf...

Kerbals speak a form of spanish?

Assuming kerbals aren't humans and kerbin isn't Earth, they should speak a completely diff lang IMO.

Kerbal speech is Spanish played backwards. If you were to download one of Squad's trailers (like the mission control one, or the one where they revealed they got onto Steam) and reverse it, the voices would (in theory) be understandable to anyone who speaks Spanish.

Failure? I do believe you mean "When the walls fell."

"Sokath, his eyes uncovered!"

I believe it's safe to assume the Devs are based out of Mexico, so Why not use some form of your native tongue?
Actually its spanish backwards and it sounds completely different from any language today so it is possible
kinda insulting to my home country...
@Daser: I assume you're from Spain? If so, the reason they did it is because they are a Mexican...what easier way to invent a language is there than to reverse your native language?
I'd still prefer a mixture of German and English.

kinda insulting to my home country...
I really don't understand why that is insulting to your country?

I really don't understand why that is insulting to your country?

'England and America are two countries divided by a common language.' - George Bernard Shaw

There is a similar belief between Spain and Mexico.

Like the English, Spain believes their former colony has 'run down' or 'degraded' their mother tongue into a lesser beast. That belief, of course, does not go over well in the now independent- and occasionally more powerful and influential- colony; they believe that they speak the language in a perfectly acceptable manner.

I'd still prefer a mixture of German and English.

Or Russian backwards , would be even harder to translate into English
Don't forget to breath in while speaking Kerbal.

My necro wasn't that bad, but still...
